description: Nikola Petrak, witnessing growing unrest and gaps in resource delivery, discreetly provides Halden's spiral diagram to trusted free zone organizers, believing local empowerment is the only viable path.

Free zone councils implement the spiral diagram in local BCI interfaces. Suddenly, emergency food, medical, and utilities caches unlock, rapidly improving living conditions in self-run districts. Eyewitnesses celebrate, while others grow wary of unintended system consequences.

Within hours of the unlocks, rumors race through the city that Halden secretly embedded the spiral override as a contingency for citizen control. Council Harmonists attempt to reassert authority by mimicking the process but cause system errors and partial sector lockdowns.

Resource surpluses and improved conditions in free zones spark copycat efforts elsewhere, while supply routes in lockdown sectors are disrupted. Directorate denounces spiral users as saboteurs, further polarizing the population.

With free zones formalizing their own mutual-aid councils using unlocked caches, citywide strikes and protests erupt—some credit Halden’s spiral as a final gift, others fear it marks systemic collapse. Power struggles intensify as centralized BCI authority continues to weaken.
